Pre-Game Insights: The Cleveland Guardians will begin a three-game series with the Kansas City Royals at Kauffman Stadium on Labor Day.
Gavin Williams is projected to start for the Guardians with a record of 2-7 and a 4.99 ERA.
Michael Wacha is projected to start for the Royals with a record of 11-6 and a 3.50 ERA.
Williams has been better on the road, going 2-2 with a 3.03 ERA over six starts away from Progressive Field.
Wacha has been better at home, going 6-1 with a 3.13 ERA over 11 starts at Kauffman Stadium.
The Guardians led the Royals by just 3 1/2 games coming into this series.
Steven Kwan is batting .283 with 11 RBIs and 20 runs over 35 games against the Royals.
Jose Ramirez is hitting .281 with 167 hits, including 31 home runs, 100 RBIs, and 105 runs in 162 career games against the Royals.
Josh Naylor hopes to contribute to the Guardians' lineup.
Emmanuel Chase is the best closer in baseball with a record of 4-2, a 0.71 ERA, and 40 saves in 43 chances.
Bobby Witt Jr. has struggled against the Guardians, hitting just .205 with 26 hits, one home run, six RBIs, and 12 runs over 32 games against them in his career.
Salvador Perez is hitting .242 with 19 home runs, 70 RBIs, and 56 runs over 144 career games against Cleveland.
Vinnie Pasquantino is another hitter who can make an impact for the Royals.
Wacha has had five quality starts in the last six games.
